Line 6975
|TENNIS -|STICH|GLAD HE STAYED AFTER|OPEN  |VICTORY .|
|        |B-PER|                    |B-MISC|         |

Line 6976
|Richard Finn |
|B-PER   I-PER|

Line 6977
|NEW   YORK |1996-08-26|
|B-LOC I-LOC|          |

Line 6978
|Michael Stich|nearly pulled out of the|U.S.   Open  |in protest over the men 's seeding fiasco but the former|Wimbledon|champion was glad he stayed after sweating out a four-set win on Monday over qualifier|Tommy Haas |.|
|B-PER   I-PER|                        |B-MISC I-MISC|                                                        |B-MISC   |                                                                                      |B-PER I-PER| |

Line 6979
|" I still feel it 's embarrassing what happened and I was about to pull out yesterday and say , ' That 's it , ' " said|Stich|, one of a host of men who cried foul over seeding procedures that forced an unprecedented remaking of the men 's draw last week .|
|                                                                                                                       |B-PER|                                                                                                                                  |

Line 6980
|" But there are so many reasons to play , especially spectators and the kids who come out here and want to enjoy watching tennis , that I decided to stay . "|
|                                                                                                                                                             |

Line 6981
|In a break from tradition , the|Open  |did not seed in strict accordance with|ATP  |rankings , instead taking into account other factors that raised objections of favourtism toward|U.S. |players .|
|                               |B-MISC|                                      |B-ORG|                                                                                                |B-LOC|         |

Line 6982
|One prominent player that did not stay for the|Open  |was|French Open  |champion|Yvegeny Kafelnikov|, who after being dropped three spots from his|ATP  |ranking to a seventh seeding , withdrew and returned home to|Russia|.|
|                                              |B-MISC|   |B-MISC I-MISC|        |B-PER   I-PER     |                                              |B-ORG|                                                            |B-LOC | |

Line 6983
|Kafelnikov|had pulled out of last week 's tournament with a rib injury .|
|B-PER     |                                                             |

Line 6984
|At a news conference attended by approximately 50 players on Sunday ,|U.S. |Davis  Cup   |player|Todd  Martin|expressed the players ' outrage at the seedings .|
|                                                                     |B-LOC|B-MISC I-MISC|      |B-PER I-PER |                                                 |

Line 6985
|" The way the|U.S.   Open  |has seeded here , tampering with the ranking system , has tarnished the image and reputation of this|U.S.   Open  |in the players ' mind , and we think that is damaging to our sport , "|Martin|said .|
|             |B-MISC I-MISC|                                                                                                    |B-MISC I-MISC|                                                                      |B-PER |      |

Line 6986
|Stich|said he felt the players ought to have organised an active protest .|
|B-PER|                                                                    |

Line 6987
|" I feel that we made it a little easy for the|USTA |.|
|                                              |B-ORG| |

Line 6988
|They did n't really get hurt as much as I think they should have , " said|Stich|. "|
|                                                                         |B-PER|   |

Line 6989
|I feel that we should have maybe just cancelled out the Monday , not show up today and start the tournament tomorrow . "|
|                                                                                                                        |

Line 6990
|But once the 27-year-old|Stich|got on the court , he focused his energies on trying to win the year 's last|Grand  Slam  |.|
|                        |B-PER|                                                                            |B-MISC I-MISC| |

Line 6991
|He took a positive first step with his 6-3 1-6 6-1 7-5 win over compatriot|Haas |on a sun-baked|Grandstand|court .|
|                                                                          |B-PER|              |B-MISC    |       |

Line 6992
|Others advancing early on Monday included 11th-seeded|American|Malivai Washington|, the|Wimbledon|runner-up ,|Sweden|'s|Magnus Gustafsson|, and two-time former|French Open  |champion|Sergi Bruguera|of|Spain|, who will be|Stich|'s next opponent .|
|                                                     |B-MISC  |B-PER   I-PER     |     |B-MISC   |           |B-LOC |  |B-PER  I-PER     |                     |B-MISC I-MISC|        |B-PER I-PER   |  |B-LOC|             |B-PER|                  |

Line 6993
|The suspicion , however , lingers in|Stich|'s mind that|U.S.   Open  |officials did tamper with the seeding process in order to benefit homegrown players .|
|                                    |B-PER|            |B-MISC I-MISC|                                                                                     |

Line 6994

|                                                        |B-MISC  |                                                            |B-PER|                   |B-MISC|        |B-PER I-PER | |

Line 6995

|      |B-PER |                                                                                                                          |

Line 6996
|The flamboyant|American|star was bumped up two spots from his|ATP  |ranking of eight to a seeding of six .|
|              |B-MISC  |                                     |B-ORG|                                      |

Line 6997

|      |B-PER |                                                                  |B-PER|                                 |B-PER |                               |B-MISC I-MISC|   |B-MISC   | |

Line 6998

|B-PER|                                                                                                                          |B-PER     |          |

Line 6999

|  |B-LOC I-LOC    | |B-PER   I-PER   |                        |B-PER    I-PER  |                             |B-ORG I-ORG     I-ORG |                                                 |B-ORG    I-ORG|       |

Line 7082
|Fernandez|( 6-13 ) allowed two runs , walked one and struck out eight for his second career complete game , both against|Montreal|.|

|B-ORG I-ORG     I-ORG |B-MISC  |            |B-PER I-PER|                                                |B-ORG    I-ORG|                                       |

Line 7148
|After appearing as a pinch-hitter in the previous two games ,|Bonds|, who has been battling a hamstring injury , did not see any action today , ending his streak at 357 consecutive games .|
|                                                             |B-PER|                                                                                                                        |

Line 7149
|It was the second-longest streak by an active player in the the majors behind|Baltimore|'s|Cal   Ripken|, who appeared in his major-league record 2,282nd straight game today , a 13-0 loss to the|California Angels|.|
|                                                                             |B-ORG    |  |B-PER I-PER |                                                                                          |B-ORG      I-ORG | |

Line 7253
|Lamonts Apparel|files reorganization plan .|
|B-ORG   I-ORG  |                           |

Line 7254
|[ CORRECTED 18:00|GMT   |]|
|                 |B-MISC| |

Line 7255
|KIRKLAND|,|Wash |.|
|B-LOC   | |B-LOC| |

Line 7256
|1996-08-26|
|          |

Line 7257
|Lamonts Apparel Inc  |, an operator of 42 family apparel stores in six northwestern states , said it has filed a reorganization plan in bankruptcy court in|Seattle|.|
|B-ORG   I-ORG   I-ORG|                                                                                                                                     |B-LOC  | |

Line 7258
|( Corrects to make clear a reorganization plan has been filed ) .|
|                                                                 |

Line 7259
|The reorganization plan calls for all secured claims to be paid in full .|
|                                                                         |

Line 7260
|Unsecured claims , including those of company bondholders , will be satisfied by issuing new common stock and warrants .|
|                                                                                                                        |

Line 7261
|Unsecured claims are estimated at about $ 90 million .|
|                                                      |

Line 7262
|Lamonts|said it plans to issue 9 million shares of new common stock .|
|B-ORG  |                                                             |

Line 7263
|Of that amount , 4.05 million and 5.67 million shares will be allocated to the company 's trade creditors .|
|                                                                                                           |

Line 7264
|Between 4.75 and 3.13 million shares will be allocated to bondholders and other unsecured non-trade creditors and 200,000 will be allocated to existing shareholders in exchange for all existing stock of the company .|
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |

Line 7265
|Bondholders and other unsecured non-trade creditors will receive warrants four about 2.2 million shares when the company 's market capitalization reaches $ 20 million .|
|                                                                                                                                                                        |

Line 7266
|Bondholders , other unsecured non-trade creditors , and existing shareholders also will receive warrants entitling them to roughly 800,000 shares when the company 's market capitalization reaches $ 25 million .|
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |

Line 7267
|Management will receive options to purchase 10 percent of the company 's outstanding common stock with protection against dilution at an option exercise price of $ 1 million .|
|                                                                                                                                                                               |

Line 7702
|Sarah Brady|-- The nation 's toughest gun control law is named after|Ronald Reagan|'s press secretary|James Brady|but it was his wife who was the major force behind its passage .|
|B-PER I-PER|                                                        |B-PER  I-PER |                  |B-PER I-PER|                                                                |

Line 7703
|As head of|Handgun Control Inc. |,|Sarah Brady|, 54 , campaigned nonstop for tough gun control in the years following the shooting of her husband and then President|Reagan|in 1981 .|
|          |B-ORG   I-ORG   I-ORG| |B-PER I-PER|                                                                                                                     |B-PER |         |

Line 7704
|Her reward was the passage in 1993 of the "|Brady  Bill  |" which requires a mandatory five-day waiting period for purchase of handguns and also mandates background checks for would-be gun purchasers .|
|                                           |B-MISC I-MISC|                                                                                                                                               |

Line 7705
|Reagan|recovered fully from his wounds but|Brady|, who was close to death after being shot by|John  Hinckley Jr   |.|
|B-PER |                                   |B-PER|                                            |B-PER I-PER    I-PER| |

Line 7706
|, suffered serious brain damage .|
|                                 |

Line 7707
|Sarah|was|Brady|'s second wife and they have a son ,|James Scott Brady Jr   |.|
|B-PER|   |B-PER|                                    |B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER| |

Line 7708
|Before the assassination attempt , she had worked for|Republican|congressmen and for the|Republican Party|.|
|                                                     |B-MISC    |                       |B-ORG      I-ORG| |

Line 7709
|Christopher Reeve|--|Reeve|was best known for playing the comic book hero|Superman|in four movies but his greatest heroics came in real life .|
|B-PER       I-PER|  |B-PER|                                              |B-PER   |                                                           |

Line 7710
|Reeve|, an accomplished rider who owned several horses , suffered multiple injuries including two shattered neck vertebrae when he was thrown from his horse at an equestrian event in|Culpepper|,|Virginia|, on May 27 , 1995 .|
|B-PER|                                                                                                                                                                                |B-LOC    | |B-LOC   |                    |

Line 7711
|Almost entirely paralyzed ,|Reeve|underwent extensive surgery to fuse the vertebrae to the base of the skull and prevent any further damage to his spine .|
|                           |B-PER|                                                                                                                        |

Line 7712
|That allowed him to be moved to a semi-upright position .|
|                                                         |

Line 7713

|                                                                                                            |B-MISC     I-MISC   I-MISC    | |

Line 7714
|Reeve|, 43 , was classically trained as an actor but became the prototypical handsome leading man .|
|B-PER|                                                                                             |

Line 7715
|He performed in summer stock and soap operas before being plucked as an almost unknown to play the lead in "|Superman|" and three sequels .|
|                                                                                                            |B-PER   |                     |

Line 7716
|Richard Gephardt|--|Gephardt|,|House|Democratic|leader , is a politician with a "|Mr    Clean|" reputation who sought the presidency eight years ago and is widely believed to still have ambitions for the job .|
|B-PER   I-PER   |  |B-PER   | |B-ORG|B-MISC    |                                 |B-PER I-PER|                                                                                                                   |

Line 7717
|Gephardt|, 55 , the son of a milkman from a working class district of|St.   Louis|, is a consummate congressional insider , sufficiently skilled in compromise and the ways of the legislature to manage the often-unruly|House|Democrats|.|
|B-PER   |                                                            |B-LOC I-LOC|                                                                                                                                       |B-ORG|B-MISC   | |

Line 7718
|A former lawyer , he was in the front line of President|Bill  Clinton|'s battle with the|Republican-led|Congress|over the budget but has opposed the president 's decision to sign the|Republican-written|welfare reform bill .|
|                                                       |B-PER I-PER  |                  |B-MISC        |B-ORG   |                                                                     |B-MISC            |                     |

|                                                          |B-LOC|                                                                              |

Line 7720

|                                                                 |B-PER  I-PER |                     |

Line 7721

Line 7722

|                    |B-MISC    |                                                                                                                                                        |

Line 7723
|Tom   Daschle|--|Daschle|, 48 , was largely unknown outside|Washington|and his state of|South Dakota|when he surprisingly beat more prominent rivals to become|Senate|Democratic|leader after the party lost its majority to the|Republicans|in 1994 .|
|B-PER I-PER  |  |B-PER  |                                  |B-LOC     |                |B-LOC I-LOC |                                                         |B-ORG |B-MISC    |                                               |B-MISC     |         |

Line 7724

|                                                                     |B-MISC    |      |B-PER I-PER|                                                          |B-PER|                                                                            |

Line 8073
|FEATURE - " Eco terrorists " target|UK   |builders .|
|                                   |B-LOC|          |

Line 8074
|Edna  Fernandes|
|B-PER I-PER    |

Line 8075
|LONDON|1996-08-27|
|B-LOC |          |

Line 8076
|Ecological warfare has broken out across the|British|construction industry , striking some of the biggest corporates as activists give up peaceful protests and seek to hit builders where it hurts -- their profit margins .|
|                                            |B-MISC |                                                                                                                                                                        |

Line 8077
|Described by one|British|company as " eco-terrorism " , it is seen as the new business risk of the 1990s .|
|                |B-MISC |                                                                                 |

Line 8078
|Famous names like|Tarmac Plc  |,|Costain Group Plc  |and|ARC  |, a unit of conglomerate|Hanson Plc  |, have all been targeted .|
|                 |B-ORG  I-ORG| |B-ORG   I-ORG I-ORG|   |B-ORG|                        |B-ORG  I-ORG|                          |

Line 8079
|Activist groups are no longer seen by|British|firms as a harmless , badly organised ragbag of students and hippies .|
|                                     |B-MISC |                                                                      |

Line 8080
|" You only have to see them in action at protests , " said|David Harding|, spokesman at|ARC  |,|Hanson|'s aggregates company . "|
|                                                          |B-PER I-PER  |              |B-ORG| |B-ORG |                         |

Line 8081
|They walk around with mobile phones and camera equipment , they communicate and gather support for demos via the|Internet|-- we 're talking about a highly sophisticated organisation . "|
|                                                                                                                |B-MISC  |                                                               |

Line 8082
|One road protestor under the codename|Steady Eddie|told construction journal "|Building|" earlier this year , " If it comes down to full-scale economic warfare , we will aim to drive them out of business . "|
|                                     |B-PER  I-PER|                           |B-ORG   |                                                                                                                       |

Line 8083
|As well as financial threats , companies also emphasise the " terror " tactics used .|
|                                                                                     |

Line 8084
|Costain|'s contract to build the controversial|Newbury|bypass , which runs through a conservation area , has led to violent protests delaying building , bomb threats , staff intimidation and picketing of chief executive|Alan  Lovell|'s home .|
|B-ORG  |                                      |B-LOC  |                                                                                                                                                                    |B-PER I-PER |         |

Line 8085
|A|Costain|spokesman told|Reuters|: " We 've had all sorts of protests at the head office and the chief executive 's house .|
| |B-ORG  |              |B-ORG  |                                                                                          |

Line 8086
|But it 's when it gets to the ( employee ) families -- that it goes across the line . "|
|                                                                                       |

Line 8087
|Tactics used by some underground groups including the cryptic|Berkshire Wood  Elves|, which distribute leaflets with instructions on home-made explosives , are now the subject of a police investigation .|
|                                                             |B-ORG     I-ORG I-ORG|                                                                                                                       |

Line 8088
|Other larger activist groups include|Earth First|,|The   Land  is    Ours |,|Alarm UK   |and|Road  Alert|.|
|                                    |B-ORG I-ORG| |B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG| |B-ORG I-ORG|   |B-ORG I-ORG| |

Line 8089
|The groups have targeted specific projects like the|Newbury|bypass and the|M3   |motorway through|Twyford Down |in the southern county of|Hampshire|.|
|                                                   |B-LOC  |              |B-LOC|                |B-LOC   I-LOC|                         |B-LOC    | |

Line 8090
|But they are also campaigning on broader issue such as stopping the government road building programme and out-of-town superstores which they say create more traffic , pollution and damage local communities .|
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                |

Line 8091
|The government has slashed its road-building spending .|
|                                                       |

Line 8092
|Although protests may have contributed to the decision it has been seen primarily as economic rather than ecological .|
|                                                                                                                      |

Line 8093
|Graham Watts|, chief executive of the|Construction Industry Council|, said : " I do n't think many firms involved in tendering for sensitive projects realise the impact environmental activity has on the cost of running a project .|
|B-PER  I-PER|                        |B-ORG        I-ORG    I-ORG  |                                                                                                                                                                  |

Line 8094
|" But they are more alert than they were 3-4 years ago .|
|                                                        |

Line 8095
|There 's no doubt it 's a big issue now . "|
|                                           |

Line 8096
|He says the damage comes in two forms : " Tangible -- in the form of extra costs , additional security , threats to staff and the more intangible damage caused by negative publicity . "|
|                                                                                                                                                                                         |

Line 8097
|Watts|said the cost of protesting can be heavy once the company is locked into a contract .|
|B-PER|                                                                                     |

Line 8098
|" I do often hear on the industry circuit of tales where the company tenders at low margins and the demonstrations which follow means they are running the project at a loss . "|
|                                                                                                                                                                                |

Line 8099
|ARC  |says it 's not just contractors in the front line but also suppliers like itself .|
|B-ORG|                                                                                  |

Line 8100
|Its own quarries came under attack after it emerged that it may be a supplier for the|Newbury|bypass .|
|                                                                                     |B-LOC  |        |

Line 8101
|" It was called the "|First  Battle of     the    Newbury bypass|' , " said|ARC  |'s|Harding|.|
|                     |B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC  I-MISC|          |B-ORG|  |B-PER  | |

Line 8102
|" We had 300|Earth First|protestors invade and occupy our site .|
|            |B-ORG I-ORG|                                       |

Line 8103
|Hundreds of thousands of pounds ( dollars ) of damage was done in one day .|
|                                                                           |

Line 8104
|Plus there was the knock-on cost of lost production and extra security in future . "|
|                                                                                    |

Line 8105
|Simon Brown|, analyst at investement bank|UBS  |, said this new phenomenon has led to a change in the way the industry evaluates project risk .|
|B-PER I-PER|                             |B-ORG|                                                                                               |

Line 8106
|" When talking to|Tarmac|about the|M3   |link ( through|Twyford Down |) they made it fairly clear that their risk assessment methods have been changed and now involve a very clear environmental risk analysis . "|
|                 |B-ORG |         |B-LOC|              |B-LOC   I-LOC|                                                                                                                                             |

Line 8107
|Harding|says others have done the same . "|
|B-PER  |                                  |

Line 8108
|As a result of eco-terrorism we are looking at controversial jobs more closely to see if the profit margins are wide enough to cover things like extra security . "|
|                                                                                                                                                                   |

Line 8109
|For an industry already suffering from razor-thin margins , overcapacity and stagnant demand , eco-terrorism is the latest bizarre twist in the construction sector 's tale of woe .|
|                                                                                                                                                                                    |

Line 8110
|London Carnival|ends in high spirits .|
|B-MISC I-MISC  |                      |

Line 8111
|LONDON|1996-08-26|
|B-LOC |          |

Line 8112
|London|'s annual|Notting Hill   Carnival|, the largest in|Europe|and second in the world only to|Rio  |, ended peacefully on Monday with an estimated 800,000 revellers singing and dancing the day away in high spirits .|
|B-LOC |         |B-MISC  I-MISC I-MISC  |                |B-LOC |                               |B-LOC|                                                                                                                   |

Line 8113
|Police said they made 30 arrests and there were two stabbings .|
|                                                               |

Line 8114
|But there was no repeat of the ugly scenes that used to scar the street festival , and police praised the crowds over the two days of festivities as good-natured .|
|                                                                                                                                                                   |

Line 8115
|Around 400 police were wounded in riots in 1976 when the carnival , now in its 31st year , acquired its darker reputation from which it is now only slowly recovering .|
|                                                                                                                                                                       |

Line 8116
|Shopkeepers still board up their windows and many residents leave town for the weekend , but for four or five years there has been no disorder and relatively little crime .|
|                                                                                                                                                                            |

|SOCCER -|BALL |RESIGNS AS|MANCHESTER CITY |MANAGER .|
|        |B-PER|          |B-ORG      I-ORG|         |

Line 8177
|MANCHESTER|,|England|1996-08-27|
|B-LOC     | |B-LOC  |          |

Line 8178
|Former|England|midfielder|Alan  Ball |resigned as manager of first division side|Manchester City |on Monday night , the club said .|
|      |B-LOC  |          |B-PER I-PER|                                          |B-ORG      I-ORG|                                 |

Line 8179
|Ball |, appointed in July 1995 , was unable to prevent|City |being relegated from the premier league last season and his record read 13 wins , 14 draws and 22 losses in 49 games .|
|B-PER|                                                |B-ORG|                                                                                                                      |

Line 8180
|They have lost two of their three matches so far this season .|
|                                                              |

Line 8181
|Club secretary|Bernard Halford|said in a statement : " The chairman and|Board|would like to place on record their appreciation of his endeavours and efforts whilst in his period of office and wish him well in the future . "|

|CRICKET -|GOOCH|TO PLAY ANOTHER SEASON FOR|ESSEX|.|
|         |B-PER|                          |B-LOC| |

Line 8363
|LONDON|1996-08-27|
|B-LOC |          |

Line 8364
|Graham Gooch|, the 43-year-old former|England|captain , is to continue playing county cricket for at least another season , his club|Essex|announced on Tuesday .|
|B-PER  I-PER|                        |B-LOC  |                                                                                      |B-ORG|                      |

Line 8365
|Opener|Gooch|'s decision comes towards the end of a season in which he has underlined his consistency by becoming the leading scorer in|Essex|'s history , beating|Keith Fletcher|'s aggregate of 29,434 .|
|      |B-PER|                                                                                                                          |B-ORG|                    |B-PER I-PER   |                        |

Line 8366
|Gooch|, who retired from test cricket after the 1994-95 tour of|Australia|but is now an|England|selector , is seventh in this season 's first-class averages with 1,429 runs at 64.95 , having hit five centuries and one double century .|
|B-PER|                                                         |B-LOC    |             |B-LOC  |                                                                                                                                          |

Line 8367
|Essex|secretary-general manager|Peter Edwards|said : " He is a remarkable batsman and still the best in this country .|
|B-ORG|                         |B-PER I-PER  |                                                                        |

Line 8368
|No-one will argue with that .|
|                             |

Line 8369
|You just have to look at his record to appreciate that fact . "|
|                                                               |

Line 8370
|SOCCER -|ROMANIA|CLUB BOSS BANNED FOR HEADBUTT .|
|        |B-LOC  |                               |

Line 8371
|BUCHAREST|1996-08-27|
|B-LOC    |          |

Line 8372
|The|Romanian Soccer Federation|has banned first division club|Jiul  Petrosani|'s president|Miron Cozma|for two years for headbutting a visiting team player , a federation statement said .|
|   |B-ORG    I-ORG  I-ORG     |                              |B-ORG I-ORG    |            |B-PER I-PER|                                                                                    |

Line 8373
|Romania|'s soccer bosses also fined|Cozma|, a well-known miners ' union leader , 10 million lei ( $ 3000 ) for the half-time attack on|Dinamo Bucharest|'s|Danut Lupu |last Sunday .|
|B-LOC  |                           |B-PER|                                                                                            |B-ORG  I-ORG    |  |B-PER I-PER|             |

Line 8374
|Miners led by|Cozma|rioted in|Bucharest|in 1990 and 1991 , bringing down the reformist government of premier|Petre Roman|.|
|             |B-PER|         |B-LOC    |                                                                    |B-PER I-PER| |

Line 8375
|Cozma|is awaiting trial for assault and criminal damage in a bar in his home town of|Petrosan|, 300 kms west of|Bucharest|.|
|B-PER|                                                                              |B-LOC   |                 |B-LOC    | |

Line 8376
|The attack on|Lupu |came during a tunnel skirmish between opposing players as they left the field .|
|             |B-PER|                                                                               |

Line 8377
|"|Cozma|'s blow was not too painful because I 'm a tall man , "|Lupu |told|Reuters|on Tuesday .|
| |B-PER|                                                       |B-PER|    |B-ORG  |            |

Line 8378
|Lupu |is one of the tallest players in|Romania|'s first division , towering over|Cozma|by some 17 cms ,|
|B-PER|                                |B-LOC  |                                 |B-PER|                |

Line 8379
|Jiul  Petrosani|, promoted to the first division this year , won the league game 1-0 .|
|B-ORG I-ORG    |                                                                      |

Line 8380
|Cozma|is barred from taking part in any official soccer activity during the ban .|
|B-PER|                                                                           |

Line 8381

|TENNIS -|EDBERG|EXTENDS GRAND SLAM RUN , TOPPLES|WIMBLEDON|CHAMP .|
|        |B-PER |                                |B-LOC    |       |

Line 8402
|Larry Fine |
|B-PER I-PER|

Line 8403
|NEW   YORK |1996-08-27|
|B-LOC I-LOC|          |

Line 8404
|Stefan Edberg|produced some of his vintage best on Tuesday to extend his grand run at the|Grand  Slams |by toppling|Wimbledon|champion|Richard Krajicek|in straight sets at the|U.S.   Open  |.|
|B-PER  I-PER |                                                                           |B-MISC I-MISC|           |B-MISC   |        |B-PER   I-PER   |                       |B-MISC I-MISC| |

Line 8405
|Edberg|, competing in the 54th consecutive and final|Grand  Slam  |event of his illustrious career , turned back the clock at|Stadium Court|with a flowing 6-3 6-3 6-3 serve-and-volley victory over the fifth-seeded|Dutchman|.|
|B-PER |                                             |B-MISC I-MISC|                                                          |B-LOC   I-LOC|                                                                         |B-MISC  | |

Line 8406
|" It 's a win that I can be proud of , " said the 30-year-old|Swede |, winner of two|U.S. |Opens and six|Grand  Slam  |titles in all . "|
|                                                             |B-MISC|               |B-LOC|             |B-MISC I-MISC|                 |

Line 8407
|It 's never easy to beat the|Wimbledon|champion . "|
|                            |B-MISC   |            |

Line 8408
|Edberg|, who has said he will retire at season 's end , made it look easy under gray skies at the|National Tennis Centre|.|
|B-PER |                                                                                          |B-LOC    I-LOC  I-LOC | |

Line 8409
|The unseeded|Swede |struck quickly , breaking|Krajicek|in the first game and never let loose his grip on the one hour 44 minute match as he served and volleyed with the grace that made him one of the dominant players of his time .|
|            |B-MISC|                         |B-PER   |                                                                                                                                                                               |

Line 8410
|" There 's not doubt about it ,|Richard|was definitely off his game and I took advantage , " said|Edberg|.|
|                               |B-PER  |                                                         |B-PER | |

Line 8411
|" I still have my days where I feel great out there . "|
|                                                       |

Line 8412

|                                                                 |B-PER I-PER  |                                                   |B-PER I-PER    |  |B-LOC    |                 |B-PER  I-PER |  |B-LOC  |                                      |

Line 8616

|B-PER   I-PER|                      |B-MISC I-MISC|                                                           |B-MISC  |                                                                                                  |

Line 8617
|Chang|, seeded second behind defending champion|Pete  Sampras|, took two hours 40 minutes to defeat 186th-ranked|Jaime Oncins|of|Brazil|3-6 6-1 6-0 7-6 , 8-6 in the tiebreaker .|
|B-PER|                                         |B-PER I-PER  |                                                  |B-PER I-PER |  |B-LOC |                                         |

Line 8618
|" I was pretty tight the whole match , " conceded|Chang|, one of the hottest players on tour this summer with a 16-2 record on hardcourts that included two titles and a runner-up finish .|
|                                                 |B-PER|                                                                                                                                   |

Line 8619
|" Everyone has moments when they get tight .|
|                                            |

Line 8620
|Hopefully , this will have been my nerves for the whole tournament . "|
|                                                                      |

Line 8635

|B-PER|                                                                       |B-PER |                                                   |B-LOC    |B-MISC  | |

Line 8636

|B-PER|                                                                            |B-MISC   |                                               |

Line 8637
|The most deflating double fault came when|Oncins|was serving to force a fifth set , leading 6-4 in the tiebreaker .|
|                                         |B-PER |                                                                  |

Line 8638
|The set point came after confusion at the net on the point previous , which was awarded to|Oncins|after the two exchanged shots at close quarters at the net .|
|                                                                                          |B-PER |                                                            |

Line 8639
|First|Chang|approached the umpire , then|Oncins|, then|Chang|again before play finally resumed .|
|     |B-PER|                            |B-PER |      |B-PER|                                   |

Line 8640

|                                                       |B-PER |                                                                                                       |

Line 8641

|B-PER|                                                            |B-PER |                                      |

Line 8642
|The 26-year-old|Brazilian|had risen into the top 30 in 1992 .|
|               |B-MISC   |                                   |

|                                                                                                          |B-LOC I-LOC| |

|SOCCER -|NEUCHATEL|TO APPEAL AGAINST|CYPRIEN|'S NINE-MONTH BAN .|
|        |B-ORG    |                 |B-PER  |                   |

Line 8748
|GENEVA|1996-08-27|
|B-LOC |          |

Line 8749
|Swiss |league leaders|Neuchatel Xamax|said on Tuesday they would appeal against a nine-month ban imposed on|French|international defender|Jean-Pierre Cyprien|for his part in a post-match brawl .|
|B-MISC|              |B-ORG     I-ORG|                                                                     |B-MISC|                      |B-PER       I-PER  |                                    |

Line 8750
|Cyprien|, also fined 10,000|Swiss |francs ( $ 8,400 ) , traded punches with|St    Gallen|'s|Brazilian|player|Claudio Moura|after a match on Saturday .|
|B-PER  |                   |B-MISC|                                        |B-ORG I-ORG |  |B-MISC   |      |B-PER   I-PER|                           |

Line 8751
|When officials and coaching staff tried to intervene ,|Cyprien|launched a flying kick at|Moura|, but only succeeded in kneeing|St    Gallen|coach|Roger Hegi |in the stomach .|
|                                                      |B-PER  |                         |B-PER|                               |B-ORG I-ORG |     |B-PER I-PER|                |

Line 8752
|Moura|, who appeared to have elbowed|Cyprien|in the final minutes of the 3-0 win by|Neuchatel|, was suspended for seven matches and fined 1,000 francs ( $ 840 ) by the|Swiss |league disciplinary committee .|
|B-PER|                              |B-PER  |                                      |B-ORG    |                                                                         |B-MISC|                               |

Line 8753
|Club president|Gilbert Facchinetti|said he was astonished the committee had arrived at its decision so quickly and vowed the club would appeal .|
|              |B-PER   I-PER      |                                                                                                             |

Line 8754
|Neuchatel|coach|Gilbert Gress|described the incident as " shocking " , but said|Moura|was also to blame .|
|B-ORG    |     |B-PER   I-PER|                                                 |B-PER|                   |

Line 8755
|"|Moura|physically and verbally provoked|Cyprien|during the match .|
| |B-PER|                                |B-PER  |                  |

Line 8756
|The referee could not have seen it or he would have punished him , "|Gress|said .|
|                                                                    |B-PER|      |

Line 8757
|" During the scuffle ,|Moura|threw the first punch .|
|                      |B-PER|                       |

Line 8758
|Tomorrow , if someone punches me , I would not know how to react . "|
|                                                                    |

Line 8759
|Cyprien|, who won his one|French|cap against|Italy|in February 1994 , cannot play in|Switzerland|or elsewhere until May next year .|
|B-PER  |                 |B-MISC|           |B-LOC|                                 |B-LOC      |                                  |

|CYCLING -|BUGNO|CLEARED OF DOPING .|
|         |B-PER|                   |

Line 8761
|MILAN|1996-08-27|
|B-LOC|          |

Line 8762
|Veteran|Italian|Gianni Bugno|has been cleared of doping after testing positive for high levels of testosterone during the|Tour   of     Switzerland|in June , the|Italian|cycling federation said on Tuesday .|
|       |B-MISC |B-PER  I-PER|                                                                                            |B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC     |             |B-MISC |                                    |

Line 8763
|" He has been cleared .|
|                       |

Line 8764
|The case is closed , " a spokesman said .|
|                                         |

Line 8765
|Bugno|tested positive for the banned hormone after the fifth stage of the|Tour  |, in which he finished third overall .|
|B-PER|                                                                   |B-MISC|                                      |

Line 8766
|But the spokesman said subsequent tests in|Cologne|proved his body produced higher-than-average testosterone levels naturally .|
|                                          |B-LOC  |                                                                            |

Line 8767
|Bugno|, who won the|Giro   d'Italia|in 1990 and two successive world titles , was banned for three months in 1994 after testing positive for the stimulant caffeine .|

|B-PER I-PER |

Line 8794
|BUDAPEST|1996-08-27|
|B-LOC   |          |

Line 8795
|Expectations that|Cofinec S.A. |, the|Hungarian|bourse 's first foreign listing , will report a disappointing first half have depressed the stock below its issue price , but analysts expect a rebound in the long term .|
|                 |B-ORG   I-ORG|     |B-MISC   |                                                                                                                                                                          |

Line 8796
|" The first half of the year is unlikely to be as strong as expected so the company will probably be unable to reach its annual plan in 1996 , " said|Gabor Sitanyi|, a London-based analyst for|ING   Barings|.|
|                                                                                                                                                     |B-PER I-PER  |                            |B-ORG I-ORG  | |

Line 8797
|The|French-registered|packaging materials company , which floated its shares in|Hungary|in July , for most of the past two weeks hovered below the 6,425 forints / Global Depositary Receipts price of its initial offering , which was oversubscribed .|
|   |B-MISC           |                                                         |B-LOC  |                                                                                                                                                                |

Line 8798
|The company , which asked for a two-week delay from the usual August 15 deadline for reporting first-half results , closed on Tuesday at 5,800 forints , down 300 .|
|                                                                                                                                                                   |

Line 8799
|"|Cofinec|'s first-half figures will be ...|
| |B-ORG  |                                 |

Line 8800
|between one-third of two-fifths of its annual plan , " said|Tamas Erdei|, a|Budapest-based|analyst for|ABN-AMRO Hoare Govett|.|
|                                                           |B-PER I-PER|   |B-MISC        |           |B-ORG    I-ORG I-ORG | |

Line 8801
|Analysts blame , at least partly ,|Hungary|'s macroeconomic environment for the weaker figures for|Cofinec|which , operating in|Hungary|,|Poland|and the|Czech Republic|, now generates about 55 to 60 percent of its annual sales from|Hungary|.|
|                                  |B-LOC  |                                                       |B-ORG  |                    |B-LOC  | |B-LOC |       |B-LOC I-LOC   |                                                               |B-LOC  | |

Line 8802
|Hungary|'s Gross Domestic Product fell one percentage point in the first quarter while real wages plunged 7.2 percentage points in the first half of 1996 .|
|B-LOC  |                                                                                                                                                   |

Line 8803
|Both will have their impact on|Cofinec|'s figures , the analysts said .|
|                              |B-ORG  |                                |

Line 8804
|Despite the current difficulties , however , analysts were convinced that|Cofinec|'s outlook was strong .|
|                                                                         |B-ORG  |                       |

Line 8805
|" The eastern|European|market offers good chances , " said|Erdei|. "|
|             |B-MISC  |                                   |B-PER|   |

Line 8806
|Just like many other companies on the bourse ,|Cofinec|has big growth opportunities . "|
|                                              |B-ORG  |                                |

Line 8807
|" At the same time , it 's an advantage for|Cofinec|that it has a foreign management which perhaps understands the market better , "|Erdei|added .|
|                                           |B-ORG  |                                                                                |B-PER|       |

Line 8808
|"|Cofinec|is a very good story in the long-term as the per capita packaging consumption is still so low in east|Europe|that a very strong increase can be expected ( long-term ) , "|Sitanyi|said , saying that several recent moves by|Cofinec|boosted its position .|
| |B-ORG  |                                                                                                     |B-LOC |                                                             |B-PER  |                                          |B-ORG  |                      |

Line 8809
|Among them , he noted that|Cofinec|had acquired the outstanding stake in its|Czech |folding company|Krpaco a.s. |, increasing its ownership to 100 percent , so in the second half the whole of|Krpaco|'s figures will be consolidated .|

Line 8846
|NEW   YORK |1996-08-27|
|B-LOC I-LOC|          |

Line 8847

Line 8848
|Both|WorldCom Inc  |and|MFS   Communications Co    Inc  |were trading but they moved in line with their close .|
|    |B-ORG    I-ORG|   |B-ORG I-ORG          I-ORG I-ORG|                                                      |

Line 8849
|WorldCom|, which said it will buy|MFS  |, shed 1-3/4 to close at 21 while|MFS  |lost 3-8/16 to close at 41-5/16 .|
|B-ORG   |                        |B-ORG|                                 |B-ORG|                                 |

Line 8850

|                                                                      |

|   |B-ORG    I-ORG I-ORG   |                                        |

|B-LOC  |          |

|                                                            |B-ORG    I-ORG|                                  |

|B-ORG|                               |B-ORG   |                           |

Line 8858

Line 8865
|Faulding|target of patent lawsuit .|
|B-ORG   |                          |

Line 8866
|ELIZABETH|,|N.J. |1996-08-27|
|B-LOC    | |B-LOC|          |

Line 8867
|Faulding Inc  |said on Tuesday|Purdue Frederick Co   |filed a patent infringement lawsuit against|Faulding|and its|Purepac Pharamceutical|unit .|
|B-ORG    I-ORG|               |B-ORG  I-ORG     I-ORG|                                           |B-ORG   |       |B-ORG   I-ORG         |      |

Line 8868
|The suit was filed because of|Purepac|'s manufacture of|Kadian|, a sustained release morphine product ,|Faulding|said .|
|                             |B-ORG  |                 |B-MISC|                                        |B-ORG   |      |

Line 9000

Line 9001

Line 9002

|                                                                                                                                                                                           |

Line 9003

|                                                      |

Line 9004

|           |B-PER |                                      |

Line 9005

|                                      |B-PER|  |B-PER |                                                                                                                                                                                 |

Line 9129

|B-ORG  |                                                                                  |

Line 9130
|The central bank management could be lifted if|Sao   Paulo|state decided to take part in the recent federal government 's plan to restructure state banks .|
|                                              |B-LOC I-LOC|                                                                                                |

Line 9131
|Under the plan , the federal government would provide 100 percent of the financing needed to restructure debt of state banks being privatized , liquidated or turned into development banks .|
|                                                                                                                                                                                             |

Line 9132

|                                                                                                                                      |

Line 9133

|      |B-MISC   |                   |B-PER     I-PER  |      |

Line 9148
|BUENOS AIRES|1996-08-26|
|B-LOC  I-LOC|          |

Line 9149
|Alejandro Lanusse|, the former dictator who ruled|Argentina|for two years , died at age 78 on Monday .|
|B-PER     I-PER  |                               |B-LOC    |                                          |

Line 9150
|Lanusse|died after being brought to a hospital a week ago following a fall at home that resulted in a blood clot in the brain .|
|B-PER  |                                                                                                                       |

Line 9151
|He was operated on earlier in the week but failed to recover from surgery .|
|                                                                           |

Line 9152
|The former dictator , who ruled from 1971 to 1973 , was best known for allowing|Juan  Domingo Peron|,|Argentina|'s famed populist leader , to return to|Argentina|after 17 years of forced exile .|
|                                                                               |B-PER I-PER   I-PER| |B-LOC    |                                       |B-LOC    |                                |

Line 9153
|Lanusse|took over the leadership of the country after five years of dictatorship .|
|B-PER  |                                                                          |

Line 9154
|But unlike his two predecessors ,|Juan  Carlos|Ongania and|Marcelo Levingston|, who ruled|Argentina|with an iron hand ,|Lanusse|steered the country toward democracy .|
|                                 |B-PER I-PER |           |B-PER   I-PER     |           |B-LOC    |                   |B-PER  |                                      |

Line 9155
|That resulted in general elections in March 1973 when the|Peronists|led by|Hector Campora|and|Vicente Solano Lima |returned to power .|
|                                                         |B-ORG    |      |B-PER  I-PER  |   |B-PER   I-PER  I-PER|                   |

Line 9156
|Lanusse|was a candidate in the election but failed to defeat his old adversories and never returned to public office .|
|B-PER  |                                                                                                              |

Line 9157
|He was imprisoned for four years in 1951 for taking part in a coup attempt to overthrow|Peron|led by General|Benjamin Menendez|.|
|                                                                                       |B-PER|              |B-PER    I-PER   | |

Line 9158
|Lanusse|'s rule saw the gradual rise of left-wing activism which culminated in another period of brutal|Argentine|dictatorship from 1976 to 1983 , during which the military launched its " dirty war " that resulted in 10,000 missing people .|
|B-PER  |                                                                                               |B-MISC   |                                                                                                                              |

Line 9159
|In his autobiography published in 1990 ,|Lanusse|described himself as a military man with " democratic ideas . "|
|                                        |B-PER  |                                                               |

Line 9160
|He was born in|Buenos Aires|in 1918 and married|Ileana Bell |with whom he had nine children .|
|              |B-LOC  I-LOC|                   |B-PER  I-PER|                                |

Line 9161
|He entered the|Military College|in 1935 .|
|              |B-ORG    I-ORG  |         |

Line 9345

|              |B-MISC I-MISC|                                                                                                                                              |

Line 9346
|The girl ,|Abyss DeJesus|, suffers from a " hairy nevus " on the right side of her face , a condition that has only been reported a few times in medical journals , the|St.   Christopher Children 's    Hospital|said .|
|          |B-PER I-PER  |                                                                                                                                              |B-LOC I-LOC       I-LOC    I-LOC I-LOC   |      |

Line 9347
|In addition to social ostracism , the condition also carries a high risk of cancer .|
|                                                                                    |

Line 9348

|                                                                                                                                                   |

Line 9349
|" She is doing well , " hospital spokeswoman|Carol Norris|said . "|
|                                            |B-PER I-PER |        |

Line 9350
|The surgery is under way . "|
|                            |

Line 9351

|B-PER |                                                         |B-PER  |                                                                                                    |

Line 9352
|More saline solution will be inserted in 16 weekly treatments .|
|                                                               |

Line 9353

|B-PER I-PER|       |B-MISC    |                                                                      |B-PER  I-PER |                          |B-MISC     I-MISC   I-MISC    |                                   |B-PER I-PER  |                        |

Line 9789
|PERTH|,|Australia|1996-08-27|
|B-LOC| |B-LOC    |          |

Line 9790
|A conman who painted common|Australian|parrots with dye to make them look like rare birds worth thousands of dollars was jailed for fraud on Tuesday .|
|                           |B-MISC    |                                                                                                               |

Line 9791
|Denham Peiris|painted six green parrots , worth about|A$    |100 (|US$   |79 ) a pair , with a cinnamon hair dye and traded them as|Indian Ringneck Parrots|, valued at|A$    |14,000 a pair .|
|B-PER  I-PER |                                       |B-MISC|     |B-MISC|                                                         |B-MISC I-MISC   I-MISC |           |B-MISC|               |

Line 9792
|Peiris|, 32 , of|Perth|, was sentenced in the|Western Australian|District Court to two years in jail for fraud after trading three pairs of impostor birds for 21 parrots worth a total of|A$    |28,000 .|
|B-PER |         |B-LOC|                      |B-MISC  I-MISC    |                                                                                                                         |B-MISC|        |

Line 9793
|" Everyone was fooled , " said pet shop owner|Shane Drew |, who unknowingly traded the disguised birds .|
|                                             |B-PER I-PER|                                              |

Line 9794
|" I 'd already had three local breeders have a look at them and sent photos and videos of the birds to the eastern states for authentication -- they said they 're nice birds , "|Drew |told reporters outside court .|
|                                                                                                                                                                                 |B-PER|                              |

Line 9795
|" After I was told they were dyed , I checked them over again .|
|                                                               |

Line 9796
|It was a perfect paint job except for one feather under a wing of one bird that was only half dyed , "|Drew |said .|
|                                                                                                      |B-PER|      |

Line 9797
|Drew |said|Peiris|, a bird enthusiast , would have succeeded with the fraud if he had not tried to trade a fourth pair of bogus birds after an associate had told police of the scam .|
|B-PER|    |B-PER |                                                                                                                                                                    |

Line 9798
|If not for the informant , the painted parrots ' true colours would not have been known for six months , he said .|
|                                                                                                                  |

Line 9799
|" They moult in the summer , so five or six months down the track , I would have looked like the guilty party , "|Drew |said .|
|                                                                                                                 |B-PER|      |

Line 9840

Line 9841
|The|O-157 |colon bacillus has been found responsible for a widespread food poisoning epidemic that has killed 11 people and made over 9,500 ill this year .|
|   |B-MISC|                                                                                                                                                |

Line 9842

|B-LOC|                                        |B-LOC|                                                                                                                     |

Line 9843
|Two children in|Sakai|have died from complications associated with the bacteria .|
|               |B-LOC|                                                           |

Line 9844

|B-PER|                                                                                                                                            |B-LOC| |

Line 9845
|Sakai|officials agreed with the assessment , but said it was too early to feel relieved .|
|B-LOC|                                                                                   |

Line 9848

Line 9901
|SEC  |adopts rules to improve investor access to best stock prices .|
|B-ORG|                                                              |

Line 9902
|WASHINGTON|1996-08-28|
|B-LOC     |          |

Line 9903
|The|Securities and   Exchange Commission|Wednesday approved rules designed to give stock market investors a better chance at getting the best price available for their orders .|
|   |B-ORG      I-ORG I-ORG    I-ORG     |                                                                                                                                       |

Line 9904
|The so-called order handling rules , which were proposed last September , were approved in a 4-0 vote .|
|                                                                                                       |

Line 9905
|The new rules will require specialists at stock exchanges and market makers on|Nasdaq|to allow customers to view price quotes from other electronic trading systems that may not be readily available to them .|
|                                                                              |B-MISC|                                                                                                                         |

Line 9906
|The rules will also require that customer limit orders be displayed with prices better than those available in quotes publicly available at the time .|
|                                                                                                                                                      |

Line 9907
|Specialists and market makers are companies or individuals recognised as qualified to maintain an orderly market in a stock .|
|                                                                                                                             |

Line 9908
|In a limit order , investors specify the price at which they are willing to buy or sell , as opposed to a market order executed at prevailing prices .|
|                                                                                                                                                      |

Line 9909
|" These rules are intended to empower all investors , by allowing their orders to compete on a level playing field , and by providing the disclosure they need to make informed decisions , " said|SEC  |Chairman|Arthur Levitt|.|
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |B-ORG|        |B-PER  I-PER | |

Line 9910
|The|SEC  |'s goal , he added , was to create " one system where one price could be available to everybody . "|
|   |B-ORG|                                                                                                   |

Line 9911
|The director of the|SEC  |'s division of market regulation ,|Richard Lindsey|, said|Wall  Street|firms will probably need to spend about $ 7 million to carry out the improvements called for by the new rules .|
|                   |B-ORG|                                  |B-PER   I-PER  |      |B-LOC I-LOC |                                                                                                               |

Line 9912
|In proposing the rules last year , the|SEC  |noted that while technology has improved , commonplace practices still existed that worked against investors ' best interests .|
|                                      |B-ORG|                                                                                                                               |

Line 9913
|It noted that customers whose orders were not displayed lost the chance of getting the best possible price available in the market .|
|                                                                                                                                    |

Line 9914
|It also cited the potential problem of a two-tiered market in which market makers quote one price to public investors while quoting better prices in private systems , thus robbing investors without access to " hidden " quotes the benefit of the best available prices .|
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |

Line 9915
|Earlier this month , the|SEC  |settled charges of alleged malpractices on|Nasdaq|when the parent of the|Nasdaq|market , the|National Association of    Securities Dealers|, agreed to spend $ 100 million over five years to upgrade its oversight of brokers ' trading practices .|
|                        |B-ORG|                                          |B-MISC|                      |B-MISC|            |B-ORG    I-ORG       I-ORG I-ORG      I-ORG  |                                                                                                         |

Line 9916
|The|SEC  |dropped a third proposal that would have allowed investors with market orders to trade at a better price if there were shifts in prices before their orders were executed .|
|   |B-ORG|                                                                                                                                                                           |

Line 9917
|The agency said it would monitor effects of the two new rules before considering the " price improvement " proposal again .|
|                                                                                                                           |

Line 9918
|The agency also proposed rule changes that would require continuous " bid " and " ask " quotations from exchange specialists and market makers who trade more than 1 percent of a stock during any quarter on|Nasdaq|.|
|                                                                                                                                                                                                             |B-MISC| |

Line 9919
|The|SEC  |'s limit order display rule will mean a major change for|Nasdaq|, where such orders have never been displayed .|
|   |B-ORG|                                                        |B-MISC|                                               |

Line 9920
|The president of the|Nasdaq|,|Alfred Berkeley|, was to hold a news conference Wednesday afternoon to elaborate on the new rules ' effects on the market , the second largest in the world .|
|                    |B-MISC| |B-PER  I-PER   |                                                                                                                                             |

Line 9921
|ITALIAN|CABINET APPROVES TELEVISION DECREE .|
|B-MISC |                                    |

Line 9922
|ROME |1996-08-28|
|B-LOC|          |

Line 9923
|The|Italian|cabinet on Wednesday granted a reprieve for media mogul|Silvio Berlusconi|'s|Mediaset|television empire with a decree extending the current legal framework for television stations until January 31 , 1997 .|
|   |B-MISC |                                                       |B-PER  I-PER     |  |B-ORG   |                                                                                                                       |

Line 9924
|The decree plugs a legal void in which magistrates could have forced the former prime minister to take one of the three stations he controls off the air because of a court ruling that no single proprietor should be allowed to keep three channels .|
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |

Line 9927

Line 9928

|B-MISC  |                                                                                             |B-LOC|                              |B-LOC | |

Line 9929

|                                                                                                              |B-LOC|    |B-ORG  |              |

Line 9930
|The express passenger train travelling from|Steyr|, southeast of|Linz |, with around 80 people on board , hit the back of a service locomotive used to shunt wagons into sidings .|
|                                           |B-LOC|              |B-LOC|                                                                                                           |

Line 9931

|                                                                                                          |

Line 9932

Line 9936

|B-LOC |                                                                                                                                                                             |

Line 9937
|"|Saskatchewan|is well positioned to take advantage of growing world markets for pork , "|Saskatchewan Wheat Pool |chief executive|Don   Loewen|said in a company statement .|
| |B-LOC       |                                                                          |B-ORG        I-ORG I-ORG|               |B-PER I-PER |                             |

Line 9938
|SWP  |said it was analyzing potential partnerships with hog farmers and expected the first deal to be in place in 1997 .|
|B-ORG|                                                                                                                  |

Line 9939
|The end of|Canada|'s rail freight subsidy last year caused a shift in feed grain production to the eastern Prairie .|
|          |B-LOC |                                                                                                  |

Line 9940
|Analysts said livestock production would likely shift to the eastern Prairie rather than feed grains being shipped to the western Prairie .|
|                                                                                                                                           |

Line 9941
|SWP  |said it may develop pork production systems that provide farmers with large integrated units , and it may consider contracting programs between producers and packers which would operate within the existing hog market framework .|
|B-ORG|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |

Line 9942

|CYCLING -|BOARDMAN|FULFILS WORLD RECORD PREDICTION .|
|         |B-PER   |                                 |

Line 10140
|Martin Ayres|
|B-PER  I-PER|

Line 10141
|MANCHESTER|,|England|1996-08-28|
|B-LOC     | |B-LOC  |          |

Line 10142
|Britain|'s|Chris Boardman|fulfilled his prediction that he would break the world 4,000 metres world record in the world track cycling championships on Wednesday .|
|B-LOC  |  |B-PER I-PER   |                                                                                                                                        |

Line 10143
|Boardman|clocked four minutes 13.353 seconds to slice more than six seconds from the previous world mark of 4:19.699 set by|Olympic|champion|Andrea Collinelli|of|Italy|in|Atlanta|in July .|
|B-PER   |                                                                                                                  |B-MISC |        |B-PER  I-PER     |  |B-LOC|  |B-LOC  |         |

Line 10144
|Collinelli|qualified in second place , also beating his old record in 4:17.696 .|
|B-PER     |                                                                     |

Line 10145
|" I was very nervous before the start but then I was amazed by the speed of my ride , "|Boardman|said . "|
|                                                                                       |B-PER   |        |

Line 10146
|I do n't know if I can go any faster .|
|                                      |

Line 10147
|Who knows what will happen in the later stages ? "|
|                                                  |

Line 10148
|Boardman|, 28 , did not contest the|Olympic|pursuit because of its proximity to the|Tour   de     France|in which he led the|French|GAN  |team .|
|B-PER   |                          |B-MISC |                                       |B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC|                   |B-MISC|B-ORG|      |

Line 10149
|However , he took a bronze medal in the|Olympic|road time-trial and then returned home to prepare for the world track series in the|Manchester|indoor velodrome .|
|                                       |B-MISC |                                                                                   |B-LOC     |                  |

Line 10150
|He adopted the " superman " riding position with arms at full stretch perfected by fellow|Briton|Graeme Obree|, the 1995 world champion , and taken up in|Atlanta|by|Collinelli|.|
|                                                                                         |B-MISC|B-PER  I-PER|                                           |B-LOC  |  |B-PER     | |

Line 10151
|Obree|was forced to pull out of his title defence because of a viral infection .|
|B-PER|                                                                          |

|England|soccer manager|Glen  Hoddle|confirmed on Wednesday that the|Liverpool|pair of|Steve McManaman|and|Robbie Fowler|would miss|England|'s|World  Cup   |qualifying match against|Moldova|on Sunday .|
|B-LOC  |              |B-PER I-PER |                               |B-ORG    |       |B-PER I-PER    |   |B-PER  I-PER |          |B-LOC  |  |B-MISC I-MISC|                        |B-LOC  |           |

Line 10211
|The two men , both suffering from back injuries , joined the|England|squad at training but it was soon clear they had no chance of making the flight to|Kishinev|on Friday .|
|                                                            |B-LOC  |                                                                                  |B-LOC   |           |

Line 10212
|" They had some scans and X-rays yesterday and they 're out , " said|Hoddle|.|
|                                                                    |B-PER | |

Line 10213
|" The more important thing for me was to get them down here and have a chat .|
|                                                                             |

Line 10214
|To go another five weeks without that chance would have been foolish , " he added .|
|                                                                                   |

Line 10215
|Hoddle|, who has already lost the services of midfielder|Darren Anderton|and defender|Steve Howey|, delayed naming any replacements .|
|B-PER |                                                 |B-PER  I-PER   |            |B-PER I-PER|                                   |
